name: ES(Amazon OpenSearch Service) EBS volume expansion.txt - Introduction
description: This section introduces the initial steps to access the Amazon OpenSearch Service (ES) cluster console and view the current state of the cluster, including allocation, health, and node information. It serves as a starting point for understanding the cluster's configuration before performing any modifications or expansions.
use_cases: Accessing the Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster console
Monitoring the cluster's allocation status
Checking the cluster's health and node information
Preparing for cluster modifications or expansions

name: ES(Amazon OpenSearch Service) EBS volume expansion.txt - Steps Before Increasing EBS Volume
description: This section provides instructions for preparing to increase the storage capacity of an Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster by expanding the Elastic Block Store (EBS) volume. It includes an image that appears to be a user interface for configuring the cluster settings, and a step to edit the cluster configuration based on the desired EBS volume size. The section assumes the reader has an existing OpenSearch cluster and needs to allocate more storage space.
use_cases: Increasing storage capacity for an Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster
Scaling up EBS volume size for an OpenSearch cluster
Configuring cluster settings to accommodate larger data volumes

name: ES(Amazon OpenSearch Service) EBS volume expansion.txt - Updates from AWS console
description: This section provides a step-by-step visual guide on how to expand the EBS volume of an Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster using the AWS console. It shows a series of screenshots that walk the user through the process of navigating to the OpenSearch Service dashboard, selecting the desired cluster, modifying the volume configuration, and applying the changes.
use_cases: Increasing storage capacity for an OpenSearch Service cluster
Scaling up an OpenSearch Service cluster to handle larger data volumes
Managing and maintaining an OpenSearch Service cluster's storage requirements

name: ES(Amazon OpenSearch Service) EBS volume expansion.txt - Steps After Increasing EBS Volume
description: This section explains the steps that occur after increasing the Elastic Block Store (EBS) volume size for an Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster. It mentions that additional data nodes are added with the increased EBS volume size, and provides a visual representation of the cluster's allocation, health, and node status after the volume expansion. This information is useful for monitoring and managing the cluster's resources and performance after scaling up the storage capacity.
use_cases: Scaling up storage capacity for an Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster
Monitoring cluster health and resource allocation after volume expansion
Managing data node distribution and load balancing after adding new nodes

name: ES(Amazon OpenSearch Service) EBS volume expansion.txt - Relocation of Shards
description: This section explains the process of relocating shards (data partitions) to new nodes during an EBS volume expansion for an Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster. It mentions that the relocation step takes time based on the number of shards in the cluster. The images provided likely show the progress or status of the shard relocation process.
use_cases: Expanding storage capacity for an Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster
Redistributing data across nodes after adding new storage volumes
Scaling an OpenSearch cluster to handle increased data or traffic

name: ES(Amazon OpenSearch Service) EBS volume expansion.txt - Deletion of Older Nodes
description: This section explains the process of deleting older nodes in an Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster after successfully relocating data to new nodes with expanded EBS volume size. Once the data relocation is complete, the older nodes with smaller disk space will be removed from the cluster, allowing the new nodes with larger disk capacity to handle the workload efficiently.
use_cases: Expanding EBS volume size for an Amazon OpenSearch Service cluster
Scaling up storage capacity for an OpenSearch cluster
Migrating data from older nodes to newer nodes with larger disk space
Decommissioning and removing older nodes from an OpenSearch cluster
